propDescriptions.children: The content of the component, normally an IconButton or string.
propDescriptions.classes: Override or extend the styles applied to the component. See CSS API below for more details.
propDescriptions.component: The component used for the root node. Either a string to use a HTML element or a component.
propDescriptions.disablePointerEvents: Disable pointer events on the root. This allows for the content of the adornment to focus the input on click.
propDescriptions.disableTypography: If children is a string then disable wrapping in a Typography component.
propDescriptions.position: The position this adornment should appear relative to the Input.
propDescriptions.sx: The system prop that allows defining system overrides as well as additional CSS styles. See the `sx` page for more details.
propDescriptions.variant: The variant to use. Note: If you are using the TextField component or the FormControl component you do not have to set this manually.

root.description: Styles applied to the root element.

hiddenLabel.description: Styles applied if the adornment is used inside <FormControl hiddenLabel />.

sizeSmall.description: Styles applied if the adornment is used inside <FormControl size="small" />.
